intro: Endiandra gem, commonly known as the golden endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain hard, angular seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical regions.
